Steinshouer, Timothy R. Klett, Gregory F. Ulmishek, Craig J. Wandrey, Ronald R. Wahl, Ronald J. Hill, Michael Pribil, Mark J. Pawlewicz, J. David King, Warren F. Agena, David J. Taylor, Abdulla Amirzada, Amir Mohammad Selab, Abdul-Salam Mutteh, Ghulam Naqshband Haidari and Moeengul Gullabudeen Wardak</origin><pubdate>2006</pubdate><title>Petroleum Resource Potential GIS of Northern Afghanistan</title><geoform>Online Reports and Chapters</geoform><serinfo><sername>U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report</sername><issue>OFR-2006-1179</issue></serinfo><pubinfo><pubplace>Denver, Colorado</pubplace><publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish></pubinfo><onlink>http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2006/1179</onlink></citeinfo></lworkcit><ftname Sync="TRUE">ghorydpafg</ftname><pubinfo><pubplace>Denver, Colorado</pubplace><publish>U.S. Geological Survey, Central Energy Resources Team</publish></pubinfo></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This shapefile contains polylines that describe structural contours of subsea elevation of the top of the Upper Campanian through Paleocene Ghory formation in northern Afghanistan. The Ghory formation is a reservoir rock unit of the Paleogene suprasalt petroleum systems of the Afghan-Tajik and Amu Darya basins.</abstract><purpose>Subsea elevation of the Paleogene Ghory formation is important in delineating reservoir rock units of the Afghan-Tajik and Amu Darya basins for an assessment of hydrocarbon resources of northern Afghanistan.</purpose><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata><supplinf>As part of the U.S. Government's effort to aid in reconstructing Afghanistan's economy and infrastructure, the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) is cooperating with the Afghanistan Ministry of Mines and Industry (AMMI) to assess the undiscovered petroleum (includes crude oil, natural gas, and natural gas liquids/condensates) resources of Afghanistan.  Funding for this effort was provided by the US Trade and Development Agency (USTDA).</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20060401</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>publication date</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>None planned</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc Sync="TRUE">62.412851</westbc><eastbc Sync="TRUE">69.454846</eastbc><northbc Sync="TRUE">37.317186</northbc><southbc Sync="TRUE">34.853707</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">62.412851</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">69.454846</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">34.853707</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">37.317186</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ArcIMS Metadata Server Theme Codes Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>geoscientificInformation</themekey></theme><theme><themekt>USGS Energy Program Themes Thesaurus</themekt><themekey>Upper Campanian through Paleocene reservoir rock</themekey><themekey>Ghory formation</themekey><themekey>Earth Science</themekey><themekey>Natural Resources</themekey><themekey>U.S. Geological Survey</themekey><themekey>USGS</themekey><themekey>Afghanistan Ministry of Mines and Industry</themekey><themekey>Joint Oil and Gas Resource Assessment Team</themekey><themekey>Geology</themekey><themekey>Oil</themekey><themekey>Natural Gas</themekey><themekey>Petroleum</themekey><themekey>Resource Assessment</themekey></theme><place><placekt>Energy Program Petroleum Assessment Units</placekt><placekey>Afghan-Tajik basin, Province 1156</placekey><placekey>Amu Darya basin, Province 1154</placekey></place><place><placekt>U.S. Department of State - Ivanov, V.I. Didura and V.P. Lupanasov</origin><title>Generalized Structural Map of the Top of the Gowr Formation in Northern Afghanistan (figure 54)</title><geoform>map</geoform><serinfo></serinfo><pubinfo><publish>Afghanistan National Petroleum Company and the Ministry of Geology of the U.S.S.R.</publish></pubinfo></citeinfo></srccite><srcscale>1000000</srcscale><typesrc>paper</typesrc><srccitea>Ivanov and Didura - figure 54</srccitea><srccontr>Structural contours and subsea elevation values of the Upper Campanian through Paleocene Ghory formation of Northern Afghanistan.</srccontr></srcinfo><procstep><procdesc>Source map was scanned, registered to cities and international boundaries (Afghanistan Information Management Service (AIMS)) and rectified.</procdesc><procsv>ArcGIS v8.3</procsv><srcused>Ivanov and Didura - figure 54</srcused><procdate>20041220</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc>Line segments were digitized and attributed on screen using the Ivanov and Didura figure 54 map as a background.</procdesc><procsv>Arcview 3.0</procsv><srcused>Ivanov and Didura figure 54</srcused><procdate>20041221</procdate></procstep><procstep><procdesc>Shapefile was projected to geographic decimal degrees of latitude and longitude.</procdesc><procsv>ArcTools v8.3</procsv><procdate>20041222</procdate></procstep></lineage><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>A scanned image of the original source map presented challenges in registration with basemap data. Afghanistan Information Management Service (AIMS) international boundaries and cities were used as registration points. Challenges were posed by uncertainty as to the projection of the original map and by systematic distortion of the base map used in compilation of the original map by Soviet cartographers for security reasons. Additionally, the original map was not available; instead, photocopies of folded portions of the original map were scanned and registered. The registration points were projected to an Equidistant Conic projection with reasonable parameters for this area and a Pulkovo 1942 datum commonly used on Soviet era maps. The image was scanned with a resolution of 200 dots per inch (0.13 mm), equivalent to 126 meters at a scale of 1:1,000,000. It was registered with a software (ArcMap) calculated RMS of 225 meters. Sampling differences between the rectified image and the NIMA reference points yielded an observed RMS of 1630 meters. The resulting accuracy falls below U.S. national map accuracy standards (508 meters at a scale of 1:1,000,000) by a factor of 3.21. Users are advised that these data do not meet U.S.G.S. standards.</horizpar><qhorizpa><horizpav>1630 meters</horizpav><horizpae>Root mean square (RMS) error of registration of scanned image of original map to Afghanistan Information Management Service (AIMS) cities and international boundaries</horizpae></qhorizpa></horizpa></posacc></dataqual><spdoinfo><direct
